Tucson knew that heading right into them would only put him in the same vun=
lerable position as Rodimus.  If he is going to rescue him he knew he had t=
o be careful as to how to approach the situation.  He looks up at the rail =
car, and then to the insectile creatures with a calculating expression.  He=
 wasn't about to tell them what he was up to.  And like a true ninjabot, he=
 crouches, builds up the energy in his legs, and then springs up with kinet=
ic force, to attempt to grab onto the rail car to get him at least away fro=
m the creatures to where he could plan his next move. 

"Not on my watch."
=

Is the only word wispered from Tucson's mouth.

lmost strident as with a rumble the door began

shadows within three insect or spider like creatures stepped

ages. Thier bodies were all well armored colored

acks - looking distinctly like Rodimus'

nd darker. Each one stood twice as
